titleproper.value: Guide to the Martin [Milton] Rackmil Memorabilia Collection <num>MSS 073</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jennifer E. Neal

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-07-13T13:17:06</date>

extent.value: in 2 manuscript boxes, 3 half manuscript boxes, and 7 flat boxes

abstract.value: Milton R. Rackmil (1906-1992) was a native New Yorker and a New York University graduate. In 1934, Rackmil founded Decca Records with Jack Kapp and Edward Lewis, and became president in 1949. Decca Records became the largest shareholder in the Universal Pictures Company in 1951, and in 1952 Rackmil took over as president. MCA bought Decca and Universal in 1962 and Rackmil became vice chairman of MCA's board. He remained head of MCA's film and record companies until his retirement in 1972. This collection documents Rackmil's career in the music and film industries. Materials include scrapbooks, photographs, clippings, plaques, publicity, certificates, speeches, annual reports, correspondence, ephemera and five vinyl records dating from 1938 to 1990. The bulk of the collection focuses on memorabilia from Rackmil's time at Decca Records and Universal Pictures from 1938-1972.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Martin [Milton] Rackmil Memorabilia Collection; MSS 073; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1994.073.

Milton R. Rackmil (1906-1992) was born in the Lower East Side of New York City. He grew up in Brooklyn and graduated from NYU with a degree in accounting. Rackmil worked for Brunswick Radio Corporation in the 1920s and helped form its record company subsidiary in the 1930s. In 1934, Rackmil founded Decca Records with Jack Kapp and Edward Lewis, and became president in 1949. Decca Records became the largest shareholder in the Universal Pictures Company in 1951, and in 1952 Rackmil took over as president. MCA bought Decca and Universal in 1962 and Rackmil became vice chairman of MCA's board. He remained head of MCA's film and record companies until his retirement in 1972.

Materials include scrapbooks, photographs, clippings, plaques, publicity, certificates, speeches, annual reports, correspondence, ephemera and five vinyl records dating from 1938 to 1990. The bulk of the collection focuses on memorabilia from Rackmil's time at Decca Records and Universal Pictures from 1938-1972.
